location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 84 to Samuel Manesty, in Charge of the Honourable East India Company at Bussora [Basra], from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter was sent with three 'country letters' that had been seized by forces of the Sheikh of Congoon [KangƒÅn]. It is stated that the Sheikh had apologised that the letters had been opened, returned them and expressed his great friendship for the English, but that he had not returned the seized vessels (that belonged to Bussora [Basra] but were loaned by the Company). The Sheikh is said to have demanded the return of one of his own ships held by Sheikh Habbeeb of Bussora in return for their release.
